114 /* public domain, Simple, Minimalistic GIF writer - http://jonolick.com
115  *
116  * Quick Notes:
117  * Supports only 4 component input, alpha is currently ignored. (RGBX)
118  *
119  * Latest revisions:
120  * 1.00 (2015-11-03) initial release
121  *
122  * Basic usage:
123  * char *frame = new char[128*128*4]; // 4 component. RGBX format, where X is unused
124  * jo_gif_t gif = jo_gif_start("foo.gif", 128, 128, 0, 32);
125  * jo_gif_frame(&gif, frame, 4, false); // frame 1
126  * jo_gif_frame(&gif, frame, 4, false); // frame 2
127  * jo_gif_frame(&gif, frame, 4, false); // frame 3, ...
128  * jo_gif_end(&gif);
129  * */
130

139 typedef struct {
140  FILE *fp;
141  unsigned char palette[0x300];
142  short width, height, repeat;
143  int numColors, palSize;
144  int frame;
145 } jo_gif_t;

147 // width/height | the same for every frame
148 // repeat | 0 = loop forever, 1 = loop once, etc...
149 // palSize | must be power of 2 - 1. so, 255 not 256.
150 inline jo_gif_t jo_gif_start(const char *filename, short width, short height, short repeat, int palSize);
151 
152 // gif | the state (returned from jo_gif_start)
153 // rgba | the pixels
154 // delayCsec | amount of time in between frames (in centiseconds)
155 // localPalette | true if you want a unique palette generated for this frame (does not effect future frames)
156 inline void jo_gif_frame(jo_gif_t *gif, unsigned char *rgba, short delayCsec, bool localPalette);

158 // gif | the state (returned from jo_gif_start)
159 inline void jo_gif_end(jo_gif_t *gif);

169 // Based on NeuQuant algorithm
170 inline void jo_gif_quantize(unsigned char *rgba, int rgbaSize, int sample, unsigned char *map, int numColors) {
171  // defs for freq and bias
172  const int intbiasshift = 16; /* bias for fractions */
173  const int intbias = (((int) 1) << intbiasshift);
174  const int gammashift = 10; /* gamma = 1024 */
175  const int betashift = 10;
176  const int beta = (intbias >> betashift); /* beta = 1/1024 */
177  const int betagamma = (intbias << (gammashift - betashift));
178 
179  // defs for decreasing radius factor
180  const int radiusbiasshift = 6; /* at 32.0 biased by 6 bits */
181  const int radiusbias = (((int) 1) << radiusbiasshift);
182  const int radiusdec = 30; /* factor of 1/30 each cycle */
183 
184  // defs for decreasing alpha factor
185  const int alphabiasshift = 10; /* alpha starts at 1.0 */
186  const int initalpha = (((int) 1) << alphabiasshift);
187 
188  // radbias and alpharadbias used for radpower calculation
189  const int radbiasshift = 8;
190  const int radbias = (((int) 1) << radbiasshift);
191  const int alpharadbshift = (alphabiasshift + radbiasshift);
192  const int alpharadbias = (((int) 1) << alpharadbshift);
193 
194  sample = sample < 1 ? 1 : sample > 30 ? 30 : sample;
195  int network[256][3];
196  int bias[256] = {}, freq[256];
197  for(int i = 0; i < numColors; ++i) {
198  // Put nurons evenly through the luminance spectrum.
199  network[i][0] = network[i][1] = network[i][2] = (i << 12) / numColors;
200  freq[i] = intbias / numColors;
201  }
202  // Learn
203  {
204  const int primes[5] = {499, 491, 487, 503};
205  int step = 4;
206  for(int i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
207  if(rgbaSize > primes[i] * 4 && (rgbaSize % primes[i])) { // TODO/Error? primes[i]*4?
208  step = primes[i] * 4;
209  }
210  }
211  sample = step == 4 ? 1 : sample;
212 
213  int alphadec = 30 + ((sample - 1) / 3);
214  int samplepixels = rgbaSize / (4 * sample);
215  int delta = samplepixels / 100;
216  int alpha = initalpha;
217  delta = delta == 0 ? 1 : delta;
218 
219  int radius = (numColors >> 3) * radiusbias;
220  int rad = radius >> radiusbiasshift;
221  rad = rad <= 1 ? 0 : rad;
222  int radSq = rad*rad;
223  int radpower[32];
224  for (int i = 0; i < rad; i++) {
225  radpower[i] = alpha * (((radSq - i * i) * radbias) / radSq);
226  }
227 
228  // Randomly walk through the pixels and relax neurons to the "optimal" target.
229  for(int i = 0, pix = 0; i < samplepixels;) {
230  int r = rgba[pix + 0] << 4;
231  int g = rgba[pix + 1] << 4;
232  int b = rgba[pix + 2] << 4;
233  int j = -1;
234  {
235  // finds closest neuron (min dist) and updates freq
236  // finds best neuron (min dist-bias) and returns position
237  // for frequently chosen neurons, freq[k] is high and bias[k] is negative
238  // bias[k] = gamma*((1/numColors)-freq[k])
239 
240  int bestd = 0x7FFFFFFF, bestbiasd = 0x7FFFFFFF, bestpos = -1;
241  for (int k = 0; k < numColors; k++) {
242  int *n = network[k];
243  int dist = abs(n[0] - r) + abs(n[1] - g) + abs(n[2] - b);
244  if (dist < bestd) {
245  bestd = dist;
246  bestpos = k;
247  }
248  int biasdist = dist - ((bias[k]) >> (intbiasshift - 4));
249  if (biasdist < bestbiasd) {
250  bestbiasd = biasdist;
251  j = k;
252  }
253  int betafreq = freq[k] >> betashift;
254  freq[k] -= betafreq;
255  bias[k] += betafreq << gammashift;
256  }
257  freq[bestpos] += beta;
258  bias[bestpos] -= betagamma;
259  }
260 
261  // Move neuron j towards biased (b,g,r) by factor alpha
262  network[j][0] -= (network[j][0] - r) * alpha / initalpha;
263  network[j][1] -= (network[j][1] - g) * alpha / initalpha;
264  network[j][2] -= (network[j][2] - b) * alpha / initalpha;
265  if (rad != 0) {
266  // Move adjacent neurons by precomputed alpha*(1-((i-j)^2/[r]^2)) in radpower[|i-j|]
267  int lo = j - rad;
268  lo = lo < -1 ? -1 : lo;
269  int hi = j + rad;
270  hi = hi > numColors ? numColors : hi;
271  for(int jj = j+1, m=1; jj < hi; ++jj) {
272  int a = radpower[m++];
273  network[jj][0] -= (network[jj][0] - r) * a / alpharadbias;
274  network[jj][1] -= (network[jj][1] - g) * a / alpharadbias;
275  network[jj][2] -= (network[jj][2] - b) * a / alpharadbias;
276  }
277  for(int k = j-1, m=1; k > lo; --k) {
278  int a = radpower[m++];
279  network[k][0] -= (network[k][0] - r) * a / alpharadbias;
280  network[k][1] -= (network[k][1] - g) * a / alpharadbias;
281  network[k][2] -= (network[k][2] - b) * a / alpharadbias;
282  }
283  }
284 
285  pix += step;
286  pix = pix >= rgbaSize ? pix - rgbaSize : pix;
287 
288  // every 1% of the image, move less over the following iterations.
289  if(++i % delta == 0) {
290  alpha -= alpha / alphadec;
291  radius -= radius / radiusdec;
292  rad = radius >> radiusbiasshift;
293  rad = rad <= 1 ? 0 : rad;
294  radSq = rad*rad;
295  for (j = 0; j < rad; j++) {
296  radpower[j] = alpha * ((radSq - j * j) * radbias / radSq);
297  }
298  }
299  }
300  }
301  // Unbias network to give byte values 0..255
302  for (int i = 0; i < numColors; i++) {
303  map[i*3+0] = network[i][0] >>= 4;
304  map[i*3+1] = network[i][1] >>= 4;
305  map[i*3+2] = network[i][2] >>= 4;
306  }
307 }
308 
309 typedef struct {
310  FILE *fp;
311  int numBits;
312  unsigned char buf[256];
313  unsigned char idx;
314  unsigned tmp;
315  int outBits;
316  int curBits;
317 } jo_gif_lzw_t;
318 
319 inline void jo_gif_lzw_write(jo_gif_lzw_t *s, int code) {
320  s->outBits |= code << s->curBits;
321  s->curBits += s->numBits;
322  while(s->curBits >= 8) {
323  s->buf[s->idx++] = s->outBits & 255;
324  s->outBits >>= 8;
325  s->curBits -= 8;
326  if (s->idx >= 255) {
327  putc(s->idx, s->fp);
328  fwrite(s->buf, s->idx, 1, s->fp);
329  s->idx = 0;
330  }
331  }
332 }
333 
334 inline void jo_gif_lzw_encode(unsigned char *in, int len, FILE *fp) {
335  jo_gif_lzw_t state = {fp, 9};
336  int maxcode = 511;
337 
338  // Note: 30k stack space for dictionary =|
339  const int hashSize = 5003;
340  short codetab[hashSize];
341  int hashTbl[hashSize];
342  memset(hashTbl, 0xFF, sizeof(hashTbl));
343 
344  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, 0x100);
345 
346  int free_ent = 0x102;
347  int ent = *in++;
348  CONTINUE:
349  while (--len) {
350  int c = *in++;
351  int fcode = (c << 12) + ent;
352  int key = (c << 4) ^ ent; // xor hashing
353  while(hashTbl[key] >= 0) {
354  if(hashTbl[key] == fcode) {
355  ent = codetab[key];
356  goto CONTINUE;
357  }
358  ++key;
359  key = key >= hashSize ? key - hashSize : key;
360  }
361  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, ent);
362  ent = c;
363  if(free_ent < 4096) {
364  if(free_ent > maxcode) {
365  ++state.numBits;
366  if(state.numBits == 12) {
367  maxcode = 4096;
368  } else {
369  maxcode = (1<<state.numBits)-1;
370  }
371  }
372  codetab[key] = free_ent++;
373  hashTbl[key] = fcode;
374  } else {
375  memset(hashTbl, 0xFF, sizeof(hashTbl));
376  free_ent = 0x102;
377  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, 0x100);
378  state.numBits = 9;
379  maxcode = 511;
380  }
381  }
382  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, ent);
383  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, 0x101);
384  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, 0);
385  if(state.idx) {
386  putc(state.idx, fp);
387  fwrite(state.buf, state.idx, 1, fp);
388  }
389 }

391 inline int jo_gif_clamp(int a, int b, int c) { return a < b ? b : a > c ? c : a; }
392 
393 jo_gif_t jo_gif_start(const char *filename, short width, short height, short repeat, int numColors) {
394  numColors = numColors > 255 ? 255 : numColors < 2 ? 2 : numColors;
395  jo_gif_t gif = {};
396  gif.width = width;
397  gif.height = height;
398  gif.repeat = repeat;
399  gif.numColors = numColors;
400  gif.palSize = log2(numColors);
401 
402  gif.fp = fopen(filename, "wb");
403  if(!gif.fp) {
404  printf("Error: Could not WriteGif to %s\n", filename);
405  return gif;
406  }
407 
408  fwrite("GIF89a", 6, 1, gif.fp);
409  // Logical Screen Descriptor
410  fwrite(&gif.width, 2, 1, gif.fp);
411  fwrite(&gif.height, 2, 1, gif.fp);
412  putc(0xF0 | gif.palSize, gif.fp);
413  fwrite("\x00\x00", 2, 1, gif.fp); // bg color index (unused), aspect ratio
414  return gif;
415 }
416 
417 inline void jo_gif_frame(jo_gif_t *gif, unsigned char * rgba, short delayCsec, bool localPalette) {
418  if(!gif->fp) {
419  return;
420  }
421  short width = gif->width;
422  short height = gif->height;
423  int size = width * height;
424 
425  unsigned char localPalTbl[0x300];
426  unsigned char *palette = gif->frame == 0 || !localPalette ? gif->palette : localPalTbl;
427  if(gif->frame == 0 || localPalette) {
428  jo_gif_quantize(rgba, size*4, 1, palette, gif->numColors);
429  }
430 
431  unsigned char *indexedPixels = (unsigned char *)malloc(size);
432  {
433  unsigned char *ditheredPixels = (unsigned char*)malloc(size*4);
434  memcpy(ditheredPixels, rgba, size*4);
435  for(int k = 0; k < size*4; k+=4) {
436  int rgb[3] = { ditheredPixels[k+0], ditheredPixels[k+1], ditheredPixels[k+2] };
437  int bestd = 0x7FFFFFFF, best = -1;
438  // TODO: exhaustive search. do something better.
439  for(int i = 0; i < gif->numColors; ++i) {
440  int bb = palette[i*3+0]-rgb[0];
441  int gg = palette[i*3+1]-rgb[1];
442  int rr = palette[i*3+2]-rgb[2];
443  int d = bb*bb + gg*gg + rr*rr;
444  if(d < bestd) {
445  bestd = d;
446  best = i;
447  }
448  }
449  indexedPixels[k/4] = best;
450  int diff[3] = { ditheredPixels[k+0] - palette[indexedPixels[k/4]*3+0], ditheredPixels[k+1] - palette[indexedPixels[k/4]*3+1], ditheredPixels[k+2] - palette[indexedPixels[k/4]*3+2] };
451  // Floyd-Steinberg Error Diffusion
452  // TODO: Use something better -- http://caca.zoy.org/study/part3.html
453  if(k+4 < size*4) {
454  ditheredPixels[k+4+0] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+4+0]+(diff[0]*7/16), 0, 255);
455  ditheredPixels[k+4+1] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+4+1]+(diff[1]*7/16), 0, 255);
456  ditheredPixels[k+4+2] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+4+2]+(diff[2]*7/16), 0, 255);
457  }
458  if(k+width*4+4 < size*4) {
459  for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i) {
460  ditheredPixels[k-4+width*4+i] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k-4+width*4+i]+(diff[i]*3/16), 0, 255);
461  ditheredPixels[k+width*4+i] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+width*4+i]+(diff[i]*5/16), 0, 255);
462  ditheredPixels[k+width*4+4+i] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+width*4+4+i]+(diff[i]*1/16), 0, 255);
463  }
464  }
465  }
466  free(ditheredPixels);
467  }
468  if(gif->frame == 0) {
469  // Global Color Table
470  fwrite(palette, 3*(1<<(gif->palSize+1)), 1, gif->fp);
471  if(gif->repeat >= 0) {
472  // Netscape Extension
473  fwrite("\x21\xff\x0bNETSCAPE2.0\x03\x01", 16, 1, gif->fp);
474  fwrite(&gif->repeat, 2, 1, gif->fp); // loop count (extra iterations, 0=repeat forever)
475  putc(0, gif->fp); // block terminator
476  }
477  }
478  // Graphic Control Extension
479  fwrite("\x21\xf9\x04\x00", 4, 1, gif->fp);
480  fwrite(&delayCsec, 2, 1, gif->fp); // delayCsec x 1/100 sec
481  fwrite("\x00\x00", 2, 1, gif->fp); // transparent color index (first byte), currently unused
482  // Image Descriptor
483  fwrite("\x2c\x00\x00\x00\x00", 5, 1, gif->fp); // header, x,y
484  fwrite(&width, 2, 1, gif->fp);
485  fwrite(&height, 2, 1, gif->fp);
486  if (gif->frame == 0 || !localPalette) {
487  putc(0, gif->fp);
488  } else {
489  putc(0x80|gif->palSize, gif->fp );
490  fwrite(palette, 3*(1<<(gif->palSize+1)), 1, gif->fp);
491  }
492  putc(8, gif->fp); // block terminator
493  jo_gif_lzw_encode(indexedPixels, size, gif->fp);
494  putc(0, gif->fp); // block terminator
495  ++gif->frame;
496  free(indexedPixels);
497 }
498 
499 inline void jo_gif_end(jo_gif_t *gif) {
500  if(!gif->fp) {
501  return;
502  }
503  putc(0x3b, gif->fp); // gif trailer
504  fclose(gif->fp);
505 }

586 //See https://github.com/mvorbrodt/blog/blob/master/src/base64.hpp for original source.
587 //The below has been modified to use unsigned characters to avoid signed->unsigned->signed fiddling.
588 namespace base64{
589  static constexpr unsigned char kEncodeLookup[] = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/";
590  static constexpr unsigned char kPadCharacter = '=';
591 
598  inline std::string encode(const std::vector<unsigned char>& input)
599  {
600  std::stringstream encoded;
601  std::uint32_t temp{};
602 
603  auto it = input.begin();
604 
605  for(std::size_t i = 0; i < input.size() / 3; ++i)
606  {
607  temp = (*it++) << 16;
608  temp += (*it++) << 8;
609  temp += (*it++);
610  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00FC0000) >> 18];
611  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x0003F000) >> 12];
612  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00000FC0) >> 6 ];
613  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x0000003F) ];
614  }
615 
616  switch(input.size() % 3)
617  {
618  case 1:
619  temp = (*it++) << 16;
620  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00FC0000) >> 18];
621  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x0003F000) >> 12];
622  encoded << kPadCharacter << kPadCharacter;
623  break;
624  case 2:
625  temp = (*it++) << 16;
626  temp += (*it++) << 8;
627  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00FC0000) >> 18];
628  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x0003F000) >> 12];
629  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00000FC0) >> 6 ];
630  encoded << kPadCharacter;
631  break;
632  }
633 
634  return encoded.str();
635  }
636 }

650  typedef uint64_t time_t;
651 
659  inline constexpr color_int_t resolveColorInt(uint8_t r, uint8_t g, uint8_t b) noexcept{
660  return ((r & 0xFF) << 16) + ((g & 0xFF) << 8) + (b & 0xFF);
661  }
662 
668  inline void resolveColorComp(color_int_t pack, uint8_t& r, uint8_t& g, uint8_t& b) {
669  r = (pack & 0x00FF0000) >> 16; //Red
670  g = (pack & 0x0000FF00) >> 8; //Green
671  b = (pack & 0x000000FF); // >> 0; //Blue
672  }
673 
678  inline time_t epochTime() {
679  return std::chrono::system_clock::now().time_since_epoch() / std::chrono::milliseconds(1);
680  }
681 
684  inline void sleep(long ms) {
685  if (ms <= 0)
686  return;
687  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(ms));
688  }

1445 
1454  class Color {
1455  public:
1456  typedef uint8_t component_t;
1457 
1458  union {
1459  struct {
1460  component_t r;
1461  component_t g;
1462  component_t b;
1463  };
1464  component_t components[3];
1465  };
1466 
1467  Color(detail::color_int_t packedColor) {
1468  detail::resolveColorComp(packedColor, r, g, b);
1469  }
1470 
1471  /*\brief Color constructor for unsigned 8-bit RGB values.
1472  \param r Red component.
1473  \param g Green component.
1474  \param b Blue component.*/
1475  Color(component_t r, component_t g, component_t b) :
1476  r(r), g(g), b(b) {
1477  };
1478 
1479  /*\brief Copy constructor.
1480  \param other Constant reference to other instance of a color object.*/
1481  Color(const Color& other) :
1482  r(other.r), g(other.g), b(other.b) {
1483  }
1484 
1485  /*\brief Name constructor. Takes a literal color name as an input.
1486  \param name The name of the color from which to derive value.
1487  \sa fromName()*/
1488  Color(const std::string& name);
1489 
1490  /*\brief Default constructor.
1491  Initializes this color to white. (all components 255)*/
1492  Color() {
1493  r = g = b = 255;
1494  }
1495 
1496  Color& operator=(detail::color_int_t pack) {
1497  detail::resolveColorComp(pack, r, g, b);
1498  return *this;
1499  }
1500 
1504  const component_t* rgbPtr() const {
1505  return &components[0];
1506  }
1507  };

2616  struct ivec2 {
2617  union{
2618  struct{
2619  int x, y;
2620  };
2621  int data[2];
2622  };
2623 
2625  ivec2() : x(0), y(0){}
2626 
2630  ivec2(int x, int y) : x(x), y(y) {}
2631 
2632  /*Array access operator overload.*/
2633 
2637  inline int& operator[](int index){
2638  return data[index];
2639  }
2640 
2644  inline int operator[](int index) const{
2645  return data[index];
2646  }
2647 
2648  ivec2 operator+(const ivec2& other) const{
2649  return {x + other.x, y + other.y};
2650  }
2651 
2652  ivec2& operator+=(const ivec2& other){
2653  x += other.x;
2654  y += other.y;
2655  return *this;
2656  }
2657 
2658  ivec2 operator-(const ivec2& other) const{
2659  return {x - other.x, y - other.y};
2660  }
2661 
2662  ivec2& operator-=(const ivec2& other){
2663  x -= other.x;
2664  y -= other.y;
2665  return *this;
2666  }
2667 
2669  bool operator==(const ivec2& other) const{
2670  return x == other.x && y == other.y;
2671  }
2672  };
2673 
2678  inline int distance(const ivec2& a, const ivec2& b) {
2679  return static_cast<int>(std::sqrt(std::pow(b.x - a.x, 2) + std::pow(b.y - a.y, 2)));
2680  }
2681 
2686  inline ivec2 middle(const ivec2& a, const ivec2& b) {
2687  return {(a.x + b.x) / 2, (a.y + b.y) / 2};
2688  }
2689 
2696  inline ivec2 lerp(const ivec2& a, const ivec2& b, float progress){
2697  if (progress <= 0)
2698  return a;
2699  else if (progress >= 1)
2700  return b;
2701  return {
2702  static_cast<int>(std::round(progress * static_cast<float>(b.x - a.x))) + a.x,
2703  static_cast<int>(std::round(progress * static_cast<float>(b.y - a.y))) + a.y
2704  };
2705  }

2708  typedef ivec2 Point;
2709 
2716  class Transform {
2717  public:
2720  Transform() : value(){
2721  identity();
2722  }
2723 
2726  Transform(const Transform& other) = default;
2727 
2733  Transform(const ivec2& point, float rotation)
2734  : value(){
2735  identity();
2736  setTranslation(point.x, point.y);
2737  rotate(rotation);
2738  }
2739 
2746  Transform& identity() {
2747  value.fill(0.0f);
2748  at(0, 0) = at(1, 1) = 1.0f;
2749  rotation = 0;
2750  return *this;
2751  }
2752 
2755  bool operator==(const Transform& other) const {
2756  bool eq = true;
2757  for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) {
2758  if (value[i] != other.value[i]) {
2759  eq = false;
2760  break;
2761  }
2762  }
2763  return eq;
2764  }
2765 
2768  float getScaleX() const {
2769  return at(0, 0);
2770  }
2771 
2774  float getScaleY() const {
2775  return at(1, 1);
2776  }
2777 
2780  float getTranslateX() const {
2781  return at(0, 2);
2782  }
2783 
2786  float getTranslateY() const {
2787  return at(1, 2);
2788  }
2789 
2792  float getRotation() const {
2793  return rotation;
2794  }
2795 
2797  Transform& forward(float distance) {
2798  //Adding the round here fixed rounding issues!
2799  at(0, 2) += std::round(std::cos(rotation) * distance); //x component
2800  at(1, 2) += std::round(std::sin(rotation) * distance); //y component
2801  return *this;
2802  }
2803 
2804  /*Backwards inline function.
2805  Just negates the input of a forward function call.*/
2806  inline Transform& backward(float distance) {
2807  return forward(-distance);
2808  }
2809 
2814  Transform& setTranslation(int x, int y) {
2815  at(0, 2) = static_cast<float>(x);
2816  at(1, 2) = static_cast<float>(y);
2817  return *this;
2818  }
2819 
2822  Point getTranslation() const {
2823  return {(int) at(0, 2), (int) at(1, 2)};
2824  }
2825 
2829  Transform& setTranslationX(int x) {
2830  at(0, 2) = static_cast<float>(x);
2831  return *this;
2832  }
2833 
2837  Transform& setTranslationY(int y) {
2838  at(1, 2) = static_cast<float>(y);
2839  return *this;
2840  }
2841 
2846  Transform& translate(int x, int y) {
2847  at(0, 2) += static_cast<float>(x) * at(0, 0) + static_cast<float>(y) * at(0, 1);
2848  at(1, 2) += static_cast<float>(x) * at(1, 0) + static_cast<float>(y) * at(1, 1);
2849  return *this;
2850  }
2851 
2855  Transform& rotate(float theta) {
2856  //6.28319 is a full rotation in radians. (360 degrees)
2857  constexpr float fullcircle = 6.28319f;
2858 
2859  //Much smarter solution than recursive spinning.
2860  //Takes the modulus between what would have been the pre-fix result
2861  //and a full circle, and subtracts the original rotation.
2862  //This gives pretty accurate rotations rather quickly.
2863  //No recursive spinning required! :)
2864  const float origResult = rotation + theta;
2865  if (origResult > fullcircle || origResult < 0)
2866  theta = std::fmod(origResult, fullcircle) - rotation;
2867 
2868  const float c = std::cos(theta);
2869  const float s = std::sin(theta);
2870 
2871  const float new00 = at(0, 0) * c + at(0, 1) * s;
2872  const float new01 = at(0, 0) * -s + at(0, 1) * c;
2873  const float new10 = at(1, 0) * c + at(1, 1) * s;
2874  const float new11 = at(1, 0) * -s + at(1, 1) * c;
2875 
2876  at(0, 0) = new00;//x
2877  at(0, 1) = new01;//y
2878  at(1, 0) = new10;//rotX
2879  at(1, 1) = new11;//rotY
2880 
2881  rotation += theta;
2882 
2883  return *this;
2884  }
2885 
2889  Transform& setRotation(float val) {
2890  if (val == rotation)
2891  return *this;
2892  if (rotation != 0.0f)
2893  rotate(-rotation);
2894  rotate(val);
2895  return *this;
2896  }
2897 
2903  Transform& rotateAround(int x, int y, float theta) {
2904  translate(x, y);
2905  rotate(theta);
2906  translate(-x, -y);
2907  return *this;
2908  }
2909 
2913  Transform& scale(float sx, float sy) {
2914  at(0, 0) *= sx;
2915  at(0, 1) *= sy;
2916  at(1, 0) *= sx;
2917  at(1, 1) *= sy;
2918  return *this;
2919  }
2920 
2924  Transform& concatenate(const Transform& t) {
2925  const float new00 = at(0, 0) * t.at(0, 0) + at(0, 1) * t.at(1, 0);
2926  const float new01 = at(0, 0) * t.at(0, 1) + at(0, 1) * t.at(1, 1);
2927  const float new02 = at(0, 0) * t.at(0, 2) + at(0, 1) * t.at(1, 2) + at(0, 2);
2928  const float new10 = at(1, 0) * t.at(0, 0) + at(1, 1) * t.at(1, 0);
2929  const float new11 = at(1, 0) * t.at(0, 1) + at(1, 1) * t.at(1, 1);
2930  const float new12 = at(1, 0) * t.at(0, 2) + at(1, 1) * t.at(1, 2) + at(1, 2);
2931 
2932  at(0, 0) = new00;
2933  at(0, 1) = new01;
2934  at(0, 2) = new02;
2935  at(1, 0) = new10;
2936  at(1, 1) = new11;
2937  at(1, 2) = new12;
2938  rotation += t.rotation;
2939  return *this;
2940  }
2941 
2945  Transform copyConcatenate(const Transform& t) const {
2946  Transform copy;
2947  copy.assign(*this);
2948  copy.concatenate(t);
2949  return copy;
2950  }
2951 
2957  Transform lerp(const Transform& t, float progress) const {
2958  if (progress <= 0)
2959  return *this;
2960  else if (progress >= 1)
2961  return t;
2962  Transform result;
2963  for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) {
2964  result.value[i] = (progress * (t.value[i] - value[i])) + value[i];
2965  }
2966  return result;
2967  }
2968 
2971  void assign(const Transform& t) {
2972  value = t.value;
2973  rotation = t.rotation;
2974  }
2975 
2981  Point transform(Point in, Point* dst = nullptr) const {
2982  Point temp;
2983  Point* dstPtr = (dst == nullptr) ? &temp : dst;
2984 
2985  dstPtr->x = static_cast<int>(
2986  at(0, 0) * (static_cast<float>(in.x)) +
2987  at(0, 1) * (static_cast<float>(in.y)) + at(0, 2));
2988  dstPtr->y = static_cast<int>(
2989  at(1, 0) * (static_cast<float>(in.x)) +
2990  at(1, 1) * (static_cast<float>(in.y)) + at(1, 2));
2991 
2992  return *dstPtr;
2993  }

2998  template<typename ITER_T>
2999  void transformSet(ITER_T cur, ITER_T end) const {
3000  while (cur != end) {
3001  transform(&(*cur), &(*cur));
3002  cur++;
3003  }
3004  }

3007 
3010  inline Point operator()(Point in) const {
3011  return transform(in);

3060 
3069  inline void drawLine(Image& imgRef, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, const Color& c, int width = 1) {
3070  if(x1 == x2 && y1 == y2)
3071  return;
3072  else if (width == 1) {
3073  //Just use the built-in bresenham line function
3074  //to draw line with widths of 1.
3075  imgRef.draw_line(x1, y1, x2, y2, c.rgbPtr());
3076  return;
3077  }
3078 
3079  const int radius = width / 2;//integer division, be careful here...
3080  cimg::CImg<int> lineGeom(4, 2);
3081 
3082  //convert line (p1, p2) to polygon (p1,p2,p3,p4)... huzzah, O(1) implementation!
3083  //start with two transforms (one for each coordinate pair), rotated to face towards one-another,
3084  //with an added 90-degree rotation (1.571~ ish radians).
3085 
3086  Transform transforms[2] = {
3087  {{x1, y1}, std::atan2(static_cast<float>(y2 - y1), static_cast<float>(x2 - x1)) + 1.57079633f},
3088  {{x2, y2}, std::atan2(static_cast<float>(y1 - y2), static_cast<float>(x1 - x2)) + 1.57079633f}
3089  };
3090  Point temp[2];
3091 
3092  for(int i = 0; i < 2; i++){//for both of the transforms...
3093  Transform& trans = transforms[i];
3094 
3095  //move it forward and back, getting the adjacent corners of the polygon line
3096  trans.forward(static_cast<float>(radius));
3097  temp[0] = trans.getTranslation();
3098 
3099  trans.backward(static_cast<float>(radius * 2));
3100  temp[1] = trans.getTranslation();
3101 
3102  //then, using a loop, copy our temporary points to the point image.
3103  //the first transform (pt a) are indices 0, 1
3104  //the second transform (pt b) are indices 2, 3
3105  //this ensures proper cw/ccw vertex ordering.
3106  for(int j = 0; j < 2; j++){
3107  lineGeom((i * 2) + j, 0) = temp[j][0];
3108  lineGeom((i * 2) + j, 1) = temp[j][1];
3109  }
3110  }
3111 
3112  //draw the rounded caps and the fill polygon
3113  imgRef.draw_circle(x1, y1, radius, c.rgbPtr());//circle 1
3114  imgRef.draw_polygon(lineGeom, c.rgbPtr());//line fill
3115  imgRef.draw_circle(x2, y2, radius, c.rgbPtr());//circle 2
3116  }

3123  class BitmapFont{
3124  public:
3133  BitmapFont(const Image& img, int asciiOffs, int glyphWidth, int glyphHeight, int glyphsX, int glyphsY)
3134  : asciiOffset(asciiOffs),
3135  glyphWidth(glyphWidth), glyphHeight(glyphHeight),
3136  glyphsX(glyphsX), glyphsY(glyphsY){
3137 
3138  //fill the glyphs vector...
3139  const ivec2 glyphSz = {glyphWidth, glyphHeight};
3140 
3141  for(unsigned char c = static_cast<char>(asciiOffset); c < UINT8_MAX; c++){
3142  const ivec2 min = getGlyphPosition(c);
3143  const ivec2 max = (min + glyphSz) - ivec2(1, 1);
3144  glyphs.push_back(img.get_crop(
3145  min.x, min.y,
3146  max.x, max.y));
3147  }
3148  }
3149 
3154  const Image& getGlyphImage(unsigned char c) const{
3155  return glyphs.at(c - asciiOffset);
3156  }
3157 
3162  inline const Image& operator[](unsigned char c) const{
3163  return getGlyphImage(c);
3164  }
3165 
3171  ivec2 getGlyphPosition(unsigned char c) const{
3172  return {((c - asciiOffset) % glyphsX) * glyphWidth,
3173  (static_cast<int>(std::floor(float(c - asciiOffset) / (float)glyphsX))) * glyphHeight
3174  };
3175  }
3176 
3181  ivec2 getGlyphExtent() const{
3182  return {glyphWidth, glyphHeight};
3183  }
3184 
3188  int getTotalGlyphs() const{
3189  return glyphsX * glyphsY;
3190  }
3191 
3195  bool isValid(char c) const{
3196  return glyphs.size() > (c - asciiOffset);
3197  }
3198 
3203  ivec2 getGlyphAxes() const{
3204  return {glyphsX, glyphsY};
3205  }
3206  private:
3207  std::vector<Image> glyphs;
3208  int asciiOffset, glyphWidth, glyphHeight, glyphsX, glyphsY;
3209  };

3261  class Text : public AbstractDrawableObject {
3262  public:
3264  const std::string text;
3265  const BitmapFont& font;
3266  TextAlign alignment;
3267  float scale;
3268 
3269  Text(std::string text, const BitmapFont& font, const Color& color, float scale = 1.0f, TextAlign alignment = TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT)
3270  : text(std::move(text)), font(font), scale(scale), alignment(alignment){
3271  fillColor = color;
3272  }
3273 
3274  Text(const Text& copy) = default;
3275 
3276  AbstractDrawableObject* copy() const override{
3277  return new Text(*this);
3278  }
3279 
3280  void draw(const Transform& t, Image& imgRef) const override{
3281  //keep track of the length of the longest line of text...
3282  int longestLine = 0;
3283 
3284  //First, split the text into lines.
3285  std::string temp;
3286  std::list<std::string> textLines;
3287  std::stringstream ss(text);
3288  while(std::getline(ss, temp, '\n')){
3289  longestLine = std::max(longestLine, static_cast<int>(temp.size()));
3290  textLines.push_back(temp);
3291  }
3292 
3293  //From there we can get some basic metrics.
3294  const ivec2 glyphSz = font.getGlyphExtent();//the size of a single glyph
3295  const int lines = textLines.size();//the total number of lines of text
3296  const int strPixLen = glyphSz.x * longestLine;//the length, in pixels, of the longest line of text
3297 
3298  //Create the temporary image.
3299  //we double the temp image size to get a proper final rotation.
3300  Image textImage(strPixLen * 2, (glyphSz.y * lines) * 2);
3301  textImage.channels(0, 3);//force RGBA on temp image
3302 
3303  int line = 0;
3304  //blit each character into the temporary image
3305 
3306  auto lineIter = textLines.begin();
3307  while(lineIter != textLines.end()){
3308  const std::string& lineText = *lineIter;
3309 
3310  //lineText alignment with some relatively simple maths.
3311  int hOffset = 0;
3312 
3313  switch(alignment){
3314  case TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT:
3315  break;//left align left needs no horizontal offset...
3316  case TEXT_ALIGN_RIGHT:
3317  hOffset = strPixLen - (static_cast<int>(lineText.size()) * glyphSz.x);
3318  break;
3319  case TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER:
3320  hOffset = (strPixLen / 2) - ((static_cast<int>(lineText.size()) * glyphSz.x) / 2);
3321  break;
3322  }
3323 
3324  for(int i = 0; i < lineText.size(); i++) {
3325  const char curChar = lineText[i];
3326  if(curChar == ' ' || !font.isValid(curChar))//skip space or out-of-range characters...
3327  continue;
3328 
3329  const Image& tempGlyph = font[curChar];
3330  const ivec2 destPosition = {strPixLen + hOffset + (i * glyphSz.x), line * glyphSz.y};
3331  textImage.draw_image(destPosition.x, destPosition.y,
3332  tempGlyph);
3333 
3334  //Apply the fill color with a multiplication filter for the size of each glyph.
3335  //for each pixel in the previously written glyph, multiply its color...
3336  for(int y = destPosition.y; y < destPosition.y + tempGlyph.height(); y++)
3337  for(int x = destPosition.x; x < destPosition.x + tempGlyph.width(); x++)
3338  for(int c = 0; c < 3; c++)
3339  textImage(x,y,c) *= (static_cast<float>(fillColor.components[c]) / float(UINT8_MAX));
3340  }
3341 
3342  lineIter++;
3343  line++;
3344  }
3345 
3346  //resize image according to scale
3347  textImage.resize(static_cast<int>(std::round(static_cast<float>(textImage.width()) * scale)),
3348  static_cast<int>(std::round(static_cast<float>(textImage.height()) * scale)));
3349 
3350  //rotate the image with nearest-neighbor interpolation
3351  textImage.rotate(-toDegrees(t.getRotation()), 1, 0);
3352 
3353  const Point translation = t.getTranslation();
3354  //draw the image centered
3355  //rotating a doubly-sized image makes the origin of the rotation essentially halfway through the image
3356  //therefore, to draw at the proper location, we need to center it relative to the transform location.
3357  imgRef.draw_image(
3358  translation.x - (textImage.width() / 2),
3359  translation.y - (textImage.height() / 2),
3360  textImage, textImage.get_shared_channel(3), 1, 255);
3361  }
3362 
3363  ~Text() override = default;
3364  };

3412  class Circle : public AbstractDrawableObject {
3413  public:
3415  int radius = 10;
3418  int steps = 10;
3419 
3421  Circle() = default;
3422 
3426  Circle(int radius, int steps, const Color& fillColor, int outlineWidth = 0, const Color& outlineColor = Color())
3427  : radius(radius), steps(steps){
3428  this->fillColor = fillColor;
3429  this->outlineWidth = outlineWidth;
3430  this->outlineColor = outlineColor;
3431  }
3432

3436

3438  return new Circle(*this);
3439  }
3440 
3441  void draw(const Transform& t, Image& imgRef) const override{
3442  if (steps <= 0)
3443  return; //no step check
3444  cimg::CImg<int> passPts(steps, 2);
3445 
3446  for (int i = 0; i < steps; i++) {
3447  Point p;
3448  p.x = int(radius * std::cos(i * (2 * M_PI) / steps));
3449  p.y = int(radius * std::sin(i * (2 * M_PI) / steps));
3450  Point tPoint = t(p);
3451  passPts(i, 0) = tPoint.x;
3452  passPts(i, 1) = tPoint.y;
3453  }
3454 
3455  imgRef.draw_polygon(passPts, fillColor.rgbPtr());
3456 
3457  if (outlineWidth > 0) {//draw outline using previously generated points.
3458  //LineLoop impl
3459  for (int i = 1; i < steps; i++) {
3460  drawLine(imgRef, passPts(i - 1, 0), passPts(i - 1, 1), passPts(i, 0), passPts(i, 1), outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3461  }
3462  //draw last line between first and last
3463  drawLine(imgRef, passPts(steps - 1, 0), passPts(steps - 1, 1), passPts(0, 0), passPts(0, 1), outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3464  }
3465  }
3466  };

3513  void draw(const Transform& t, Image& imgRef) const override{
3514  if (points.empty())
3515  return;
3516  /*CImg requires all polygons to be passed in as an instance of
3517  the image object. Therefore, we can specify an "int" image with
3518  a width of 2 (x,y) and height of the total number of
3519  elements in the point vector.*/
3520  cimg::CImg<int> passPts(static_cast<int>(points.size()), 2);
3521

3523  const Point pt = t(points[i]);
3524  passPts(i, 0) = pt.x;
3525  passPts(i, 1) = pt.y;
3526  }

3529 
3530  if (outlineWidth > 0) {//draw outline using previously generated points.
3531  //LineLoop impl
3532  for (int i = 1; i < points.size(); i++) {
3533  drawLine(imgRef, passPts(i - 1, 0), passPts(i - 1, 1), passPts(i, 0), passPts(i, 1), outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3534  }
3535  //draw last line between first and last
3536  drawLine(imgRef, passPts(int(points.size()) - 1, 0), passPts(int(points.size()) - 1, 1), passPts(0, 0), passPts(0, 1), outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3537  }
3538  }

3575  void draw(const Transform& t, Image& imgRef) const override{
3576  //Vertex order is as follows for the constructed quad.
3577  // 0--3 3
3578  // | / /|
3579  // |/ / |
3580  // 1 1--2
3581 
3582  const int halfW = drawWidth / 2;
3583  const int halfH = drawHeight / 2;
3584 
3585  Point destPoints[4] = {
3586  {-halfW, halfH}, //0
3587  {-halfW, -halfH}, //1
3588  {halfW, -halfH}, //2
3589  {halfW, halfH} //3
3590  };
3591 
3592  Point texturePoints[4] = {
3593  {srcX, srcY},
3594  {srcX, srcY + srcH},
3595  {srcX + srcW, srcY},
3596  {srcX + srcW, srcY + srcH}
3597  };
3598 
3600  for (Point& pt : destPoints)
3601  pt = t(pt);
3602 
3603  //Yes, I know this isn't particularly readable.
3604  //But its purpose is described in an above commented illustration.
3605  imgRef.draw_triangle(destPoints[0][0], destPoints[0][1], destPoints[1][0], destPoints[1][1], destPoints[3][0], destPoints[3][1],
3606  spriteImg, texturePoints[0][0], texturePoints[0][1], texturePoints[1][0], texturePoints[1][1], texturePoints[3][0], texturePoints[3][1]);
3607  imgRef.draw_triangle(destPoints[1][0], destPoints[1][1], destPoints[2][0], destPoints[2][1], destPoints[3][0], destPoints[3][1],
3608  spriteImg, texturePoints[1][0], texturePoints[1][1], texturePoints[2][0], texturePoints[2][1], texturePoints[3][0], texturePoints[3][1]);
3609 
3610  if (outlineWidth > 0) {//draw outline using previously generated points.
3611  //LineLoop impl
3612  for (int i = 1; i < 4; i++) {
3613  drawLine(imgRef, destPoints[i - 1][0], destPoints[i - 1][1], destPoints[i][0], destPoints[i][1], outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3614  }
3615  //draw last line between first and last
3616  drawLine(imgRef, destPoints[3][0], destPoints[3][1], destPoints[0][0], destPoints[0][1], outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3617  }
3618  }
3619  protected:
3620  Image& spriteImg;
3621  };

3944  static Image decodeDefaultFont(){
3945  Image img(DEFAULT_FONT_PIXELS_WIDTH, DEFAULT_FONT_PIXELS_HEIGHT);
3946  img.channels(0, 3);//force RGBA
3947  for(int pixId = 0; pixId < DEFAULT_FONT_PIXELS_LEN; pixId++){
3948  const unsigned int decodeVal = DEFAULT_FONT_PIXELS[pixId];
3949  // 8 integers per row of pixels (8*32=256)
3950  const int pixY = pixId / 8;
3951  const int pixOffsX = (pixId % 8) * 32;//offset of every pixel for the current integer.
3952 
3953  for(int i = 0; i < 32; i++){ // for every bit in the unsigned integer...
3954  const int pixX = pixOffsX + (31 - i);//31 due to number of bits in unsigned int...
3955  //get i'th pixel in the integer by bitmask and multiply
3956  const uint8_t pixel = ((decodeVal >> i) & 1) * 255;
3957  for(int c = 0; c < 4; c++)
3958  img(pixX, pixY, 0, c) = pixel;
3959  }
3960  }
3961  return img;
3962  }

4255  float towards(int x, int y){
4256  float amt = std::atan2(static_cast<float>(y) - transform->getTranslateY(), static_cast<float>(x) - transform->getTranslateX());
4257 
4258  //6.28319 is a full rotation in radians...
4259  if(toDegrees(amt) < 0)
4260  amt = 6.28319f + amt;
4261 
4262  //convert to degrees if necessary.
4263  amt = state->angleMode ? amt : toDegrees(amt);
4264  return amt + heading();
4265  }

4323  void fill(bool val){
4324  if(state->filling && !val) {
4325  //Add the fill polygon
4326  screen->getScene().emplace_back(new Polygon(fillAccum.points, state->fillColor), Transform());
4327  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end(), 1));
4328 
4329  //Add all trace lines created when tracing out the fill polygon.
4330  if(!fillLines.empty()) {
4331  //for each line we've created when having the pen down, and have been tracing a shape
4332  for(Line& lineInfo : fillLines) {
4333  screen->getScene().emplace_back(lineInfo.copy(), Transform());
4334  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end(), 1));
4335  }
4336  fillLines.clear();
4337  }
4338 
4339  fillAccum.points.clear();
4340  updateParent(false, false);
4341  }
4342  state->filling = val;
4343  }

4414  void clearstamp(int stampid){
4415  auto iter = objects.begin(); //iterator which holds an iterator to the screen's scene list.
4416 
4417  while (iter != objects.end()) {
4418  auto& objIter = *iter;
4419  if (objIter->stamp && objIter->stampid == stampid) {
4420  break;
4421  }
4422  iter++;
4423  }
4424 
4425  if (iter != objects.end()) {
4426  objects.erase(iter);
4427 
4428  if (screen != nullptr) {
4429  screen->getScene().erase(*iter);
4430  }
4431  }
4432 
4433  updateParent(true,false);
4434  }
4435 
4438  void clearstamps(int stampid = -1){
4439  typedef decltype(objects.begin()) iter_t;
4440 
4441  std::list<iter_t> removals;
4442 
4443  auto iter = objects.begin();
4444  while (iter != objects.end()) {
4445  auto& objIter = *iter;
4446  if (stampid < 0 ? objIter->stamp : (objIter->stamp && objIter->stampid <= stampid)) {
4447  removals.push_back(iter);
4448  }
4449  iter++;
4450  }
4451 
4452  for (auto& iter : removals) {
4453  screen->getScene().erase(*iter);
4454  objects.erase(iter);
4455  }
4456 
4457  updateParent(true, false);
4458  }

4482  bool undo(bool try_redraw = true){
4483  //total objects on the state stack prior to
4484  const unsigned long int totalBefore = state->objectsBefore;
4485 
4486  if (stateStack.size() >= 2)
4487  travelBack(); //Travel back if stack size >= 2
4488 
4489  //If we can't pop the state, break early.
4490  if (!popState()) {
4491  return false;
4492  }
4493 
4494  auto begin = std::prev(objects.end(), (totalBefore - state->objectsBefore));
4495  auto iter = begin;
4496 
4497  while (iter != objects.end()) {
4498  screen->getScene().erase(*iter);
4499  iter++;
4500  }
4501 
4502  objects.erase(begin, objects.end());
4503 
4504  //Will invalidate the whole screen due to object removal, but we allow the option to not.
4505  updateParent(try_redraw, false);
4506  return true;
4507  }

4513  size = 1;
4514

4516  while (stateStack.size() > size) {
4517  stateStack.pop_front();
4518  }

4622  void draw(const Transform& screenTransform, Image& canvas){
4623  if (this->screen == nullptr)
4624  return;
4625 
4626  if (!state->visible)
4627  return;
4628 
4629  //Draw all lines queued during filling a shape.
4630  //This is only populated when the turtle moves between a beginfill
4631  //and endfill while the pen is down.
4632  for (const Line& line : fillLines)
4633  line.draw(screenTransform, canvas);
4634 
4635  if (traveling && state->tracing) {
4636  //Draw the "Travel-Line" when in the middle of the travelTo func
4637  travelPoints[0] = screenTransform(travelPoints[0]);
4638  travelPoints[1] = screenTransform(travelPoints[1]);
4639  drawLine(canvas, travelPoints[0].x, travelPoints[0].y, travelPoints[1].x, travelPoints[1].y, state->penColor, state->penWidth);
4640  }
4641 
4642  //Add the extra rotate to start cursor facing right :)
4643  const float cursorRot = this->screen->mode() == SM_STANDARD ? 1.5708f : -3.1416f;
4644  Transform cursorTransform = screenTransform.copyConcatenate(*transform).rotate(cursorRot + state->cursorTilt);
4645  state->cursor->fillColor = state->fillColor;
4646  state->cursor->outlineWidth = 1;
4647  state->cursor->outlineColor = state->penColor;
4648  state->cursor->draw(cursorTransform, canvas);
4649  }

4668  void reset(){
4669  //Reset objects, transforms, trace lines, state, etc.
4670 
4671  //Note to self, clearing the list, appending a new transform,
4672  //then reassigning the transform reference just didn't want to work.
4673  //I have no idea why. Therefore, we're resetting it in the same
4674  //manner we initially construct it.
4675  stateStack = {PenState()};
4676  state = &stateStack.back();
4677 
4678  transform = &state->transform;
4679  const auto numItems = objects.size();
4680 
4681  if (screen != nullptr) {
4682  //Re-assign cursor on reset, derived from parent screen.
4683  state->cursor.reset(screen->shape("indented triangle").copy());
4684  //Erase all objects
4685  while (!objects.empty()) {
4686  screen->getScene().erase(objects.front());
4687  objects.pop_front();
4688  }
4689 
4690  //Alter cursor tilt and default transform
4691  //when operating under SM_LOGO mode.
4692  //This is to bring it up-to-par with Python's
4693  //implementation of screen modes.
4694  if (screen->mode() == SM_LOGO) {
4695  state->cursorTilt = (-1.5708f);
4696  transform->rotate(1.5708f);
4697  }
4698  }
4699 
4700  updateParent(numItems > 0, false);
4701  }

4709  virtual ~Turtle(){
4710  //remove itself from its parent screen...
4711  if(screen != nullptr)
4712  screen->remove(*this);
4713  }
4714  protected:
4715  //a list of iterators that point to the parent screen's scene list.
4716  //this list is in-order as they are created by this instance.
4717  std::list<std::list<SceneObject>::iterator> objects;
4718  //the pen-state stack is, as its name might imply, the previous states
4719  //of the pen owned by this turtle.
4720  std::list<PenState> stateStack = {PenState()};
4721  std::list<Line> fillLines;
4722 
4723  //the current transform. This points to the topmost state's transform
4724  //on the pen state stack.
4725  Transform* transform = nullptr;
4726  //the current state. This points directly to the topmost state
4727  //on the pen state stack.
4728  PenState* state = nullptr;
4729 
4730  /* These variables are used to draw the "travel" line when
4731  * the turtle is traveling. (e.g, the line between where it's going
4732  * and where it's been)*/
4733  Point travelPoints[2];
4734  bool traveling = false;
4735 
4736  /*Undo stack size.*/
4737  unsigned int undoStackSize = 100;
4738 
4739  /*Accumulator for fill state*/
4740  Polygon fillAccum;
4741 
4742  /*Screen pointer. Assign before calling any other function!*/
4743  AbstractTurtleScreen* screen = nullptr;
4744 
4745  /*Pushes a copy of the pen's state on the stack.*/
4746  void pushState(){
4747  if (stateStack.size() + 1 > undoStackSize)
4748  stateStack.pop_front();
4749 
4750  stateStack.push_back(stateStack.back()); //Push a copy of the back-most pen state.
4751  state = &stateStack.back();
4752  transform = &state->transform;
4753  state->objectsBefore = objects.size();
4754  }
4755 
4756  /*Pops the top of the pen's state stack.*/
4757  bool popState(){
4758  if (stateStack.size() == 1)
4759  return false;
4760  stateStack.pop_back();
4761  state = &stateStack.back();
4762  transform = &state->transform;
4763  return true;
4764  }

4773  bool pushGeometry(const Transform& t, AbstractDrawableObject* geom){
4774  if (screen != nullptr) {
4775  pushState();
4776  screen->getScene().emplace_back(geom, t);
4777  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end()));
4778  return true;
4779  }
4780  return false;
4781  }
4782 
4787  bool pushStamp(const Transform& t, AbstractDrawableObject* geom){
4788  if (screen != nullptr) {
4789  pushState();
4790  const float cursorRot = this->screen->mode() == SM_STANDARD ? 1.5708f : -3.1416f;
4791 
4792  Transform trans(t);
4793  trans.rotate(cursorRot + state->cursorTilt);
4794 
4795  geom->outlineWidth = 1;
4796  geom->outlineColor = state->penColor;
4797 
4798  screen->getScene().emplace_back(geom, trans, state->curStamp++);
4799  SceneObject& obj = screen->getScene().back();
4800 
4801  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end()));
4802  return true;
4803  }
4804  return false;
4805  }

4814  bool pushText(const Transform& t, const Color& color, const BitmapFont& font, const std::string& text, float scale = 1.0f, TextAlign alignment = TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT){
4815  if (screen != nullptr) {
4816  pushState();
4817  screen->getScene().emplace_back(new Text(text, font, color, scale, alignment), t);
4818  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end()));
4819  return true;
4820  }

4822  }

4829  bool pushTraceLine(Point a, Point b){
4830  if (screen != nullptr) {
4831  screen->getScene().emplace_back(new Line(a, b, state->penColor, state->penWidth), Transform());
4832  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end()));
4833  //Trace lines do NOT push a state->
4834  //Their state is encompassed by movement,
4835  //and these lines are only added when moving the turtle
4836  //while the pen is down.
4837  return true;
4838  }
4839  return false;
4840  }
4841 
4844  long int getAnimMS() {
4845  if(screen == nullptr)
4846  return 0;
4847 
4848  //300 is the "scale" animations adhere to.
4849  //The longest animation is 300 milliseconds, shortest is 0.
4850  //This was an arbitrary choice, trying to match the speed of the Python implementation.
4851  if(!screen->supports_live_animation() || state->moveSpeed < 0)
4852  return 0;//no animation means no time spent animating...
4853  return long((state->moveSpeed / 10.0f) * 300); //<----
4854  }
4855 
4857  void updateParent(bool invalidate = false, bool input = true){
4858  if (screen != nullptr)
4859  screen->update(invalidate, input);
4860  }
4861 
4867  void travelBetween(Transform src, const Transform& dest, bool doPushState){
4868  if(dest == src)
4869  return;
4870 
4871  //Set the "traveling" state for screen drawing. Indicates when to draw travel lines (e.g, when pen is down).
4872  traveling = true;
4873 
4874  const auto duration = static_cast<float>(getAnimMS());
4875  if ((screen ? !screen->isclosed() : false) && duration > 0) {//no point in animating with no screen
4876  const unsigned long startTime = detail::epochTime();
4877 
4878  float progress = 0;
4879  while (progress < 1.0f) {
4880  const unsigned long curTime = detail::epochTime();
4881 
4882  transform->assign(src.lerp(dest, progress));
4883  travelPoints[0] = src.getTranslation();
4884  travelPoints[1] = transform->getTranslation();
4885 
4886  updateParent(false, false);
4887 
4888  progress = (static_cast<float>(curTime - startTime) / duration);
4889  }
4890  }
4891 
4892  if(doPushState){
4893  if (state->tracing && !state->filling) {
4894  pushTraceLine(src.getTranslation(), dest.getTranslation());
4895  } else if (state->filling) {
4896  fillAccum.points.push_back(dest.getTranslation());
4897  if (state->tracing) {
4898  fillLines.emplace_back(src.getTranslation(), dest.getTranslation(), state->penColor, state->penWidth);
4899  }
4900  }
4901 
4902  transform->assign(src);
4903  pushState();
4904  }
4905 
4906  transform->assign(dest);
4907  traveling = false;
4908  updateParent(false, false);
4909  }
4910 
4915  void travelTo(const Transform& dest){
4916  travelBetween(*transform, dest, true);
4917  }
4918 
4923  void travelBack(){
4924  travelBetween(*transform, std::prev(stateStack.end(), 2)->transform, false);
4925  }
4926 
4928  Turtle() = default;
4929  };

4931 #ifdef CTURTLE_HEADLESS
4932  /*Used to output Base-64 GIF and HTML source for OfflineTurtleScreen.*/
4933  inline std::string encodeFileBase64(const std::string& path){
4934  std::ifstream file(path, std::ios::binary | std::ios::ate);
4935  std::streamsize size = file.tellg();
4936  file.seekg(0, std::ios::beg);
4937 
4938  std::vector<unsigned char> buffer(size, 0);
4939  file.read((char*)buffer.data(), size);
4940  return base64::encode(buffer);
4941  }

5074 
5075  virtual void redraw(bool invalidate = false){
5076  if (isclosed())
5077  return;
5078  int fromBack = 0;
5079  bool hasInvalidated = invalidate;
5080 
5081  //Handle resizes.
5082 
5083  if (lastTotalObjects <= objects.size()) {
5084  fromBack = static_cast<int>(objects.size() - lastTotalObjects);
5085  }
5086 
5087  if (hasInvalidated) {
5088  canvas.draw_rectangle(0, 0, canvas.width(), canvas.height(), backgroundColor.rgbPtr());
5089  redrawCounter = 0;//Forced redraw due to canvas invalidation.
5090  } else {
5091  if(redrawCounterMax == 0){
5092  return;
5093  }
5094 
5095  redrawCounter++;
5096 
5097  if (redrawCounter >= redrawCounterMax) {
5098  redrawCounter = 0;
5099  } else {
5100  return;
5101  }
5102  }
5103 
5104  auto latestIter = !hasInvalidated ? std::prev(objects.end(), fromBack) : objects.begin();
5105 
5106  Transform screen = screentransform();
5107  while (latestIter != objects.end()) {
5108  SceneObject& object = *latestIter;
5109  const Transform t(screen.copyConcatenate(object.transform));
5110 
5111  object.geom->draw(t, canvas);
5112 
5113  latestIter++;
5114  }
5115 
5116  if (canvas.width() != turtleComposite.width() || canvas.height() != turtleComposite.height()) {
5117  turtleComposite.assign(canvas);
5118  } else {
5119  //This works off the assumption that drawImage is accelerated.
5120  //There might be a more efficient way to do this, however.
5121  turtleComposite.draw_image(0, 0, canvas);
5122  }
5123 
5124  for (Turtle* turt : turtles)
5125  turt->draw(screen, turtleComposite);
5126 
5127  lastTotalObjects = static_cast<int>(objects.size());
5128 
5129  /* The following code takes the place of swapping the display buffer for the canvas,
5130  * which is what the interactive mode does.*/
5131 
5132  //This copy is NOT efficient.
5133  //We should be able to take advantage of loop unrolling here
5134  for(int x = 0; x < CTURTLE_HEADLESS_WIDTH; x++){
5135  for(int y = 0; y < CTURTLE_HEADLESS_HEIGHT; y++){
5136  uint8_t* pixel = (&gifWriteBuffer[(y*CTURTLE_HEADLESS_WIDTH+x)*4]);
5137 
5138  pixel[0] = turtleComposite(x,y,0);
5139  pixel[1] = turtleComposite(x,y,1);
5140  pixel[2] = turtleComposite(x,y,2);
5141  pixel[3] = 255;
5142  }
5143  }
5144 
5145  //GIF frames are measured in centiseconds, thus the /10 on the delayMS...
5146  jo_gif_frame(&gif, gifWriteBuffer, delayMS / 10, true);
5147  }
5148 
5149  Transform screentransform() const{
5150  return Transform().translate(canvas.width()/2, canvas.height()/2).scale(1, -1.0f);
5151  }

5200  Image turtleComposite;

5208

5418  void update(bool invalidateDraw, bool processInput) override{
5419  /*Resize canvas when necessary.*/
5420  if (display.is_resized()) {
5421  display.resize();
5422  invalidateDraw = true;
5423  }
5424  redraw(invalidateDraw);
5425 
5426  if (processInput && !timerBindings.empty()) {
5427  //Call timer bindings first.
5428  uint64_t curTime = detail::epochTime();
5429  for (auto& timer : timerBindings) {
5430  auto& func = std::get<0>(timer);
5431  uint64_t reqTime = std::get<1>(timer);
5432  uint64_t& lastCalled = std::get<2>(timer);
5433 
5434  if (curTime >= lastCalled + reqTime) {
5435  lastCalled = curTime;
5436  func();
5437  }
5438  }
5439  }
5440 
5442  if (cachedEvents.empty() || !processInput)
5443  return; //No events to process.
5444 
5445  //lock event cache to avoid race conditions
5446  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5447 
5448  for (InputEvent& event : cachedEvents) {
5449  if (event.type) {//process keyboard event
5450  KeyFunc& keyFunc = *reinterpret_cast<KeyFunc*> (event.cbPointer);
5451  keyFunc();
5452  } else {//process mouse event
5453  MouseFunc& mFunc = *reinterpret_cast<MouseFunc*> (event.cbPointer);
5454  mFunc(event.mX, event.mY);
5455  }
5456  }
5457 
5458  cachedEvents.clear();
5459  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5460  }

5535  void redraw(bool invalidate) override{
5536  if (isclosed())
5537  return;
5538  int fromBack = 0;
5539  bool hasInvalidated = invalidate;
5540 
5541  //Handle resizes.
5542  if (display.window_width() != canvas.width() || display.window_height() != canvas.height()) {
5543  canvas.resize(display);
5544  hasInvalidated = true;
5545  }
5546 
5547  if (lastTotalObjects <= objects.size()) {
5548  fromBack = static_cast<int>(objects.size() - lastTotalObjects);
5549  }
5550 
5551  if (hasInvalidated) {
5552  if(!backgroundImage.is_empty()){
5553  const int centerX = (canvas.width() / 2) - (backgroundImage.width() / 2);
5554  const int centerY = (canvas.height() / 2) - (backgroundImage.height() / 2);
5555  canvas.draw_image(centerX, centerY, backgroundImage);
5556  }
5557  else canvas.draw_rectangle(0, 0, canvas.width(), canvas.height(), backgroundColor.rgbPtr());
5558 
5559  redrawCounter = 0;//Forced redraw due to canvas invalidation.
5560  } else {
5561  if(redrawCounterMax == 0)//tracer settings may disable rendering for a short time...
5562  return;
5563  redrawCounter++;
5564 
5565  if(redrawCounter >= redrawCounterMax)
5566  redrawCounter = 0;
5567  else return;
5568  }
5569 
5570  //get the iterator pointing to the oldest scene object that hasn't been drawn yet
5571  //if the scene has been invalidated, the latest object is the first one in the scene.
5572  //otherwise,
5573  auto latestIter = !hasInvalidated ? std::prev(objects.end(), fromBack) : objects.begin();
5574 
5575  const Transform screen = screentransform();
5576  while (latestIter != objects.end()) {
5577  SceneObject& object = *latestIter;
5578  const Transform t(screen.copyConcatenate(object.transform));
5579  object.geom->draw(t, canvas);
5580 
5581  latestIter++;
5582  }
5583 
5584  if (canvas.width() != turtleComposite.width() || canvas.height() != turtleComposite.height()) {
5585  turtleComposite.assign(canvas);
5586  } else {
5587  //This works off the assumption that drawImage is accelerated.
5588  //There might be a more efficient way to do this, however.
5589  turtleComposite.draw_image(0, 0, canvas);
5590  }
5591 
5592  for (Turtle* turt : turtles)
5593  turt->draw(screen, turtleComposite);
5594 
5595  lastTotalObjects = static_cast<int>(objects.size());
5596  display.display(turtleComposite);
5597  detail::sleep(delayMS);
5598  }
5599 
5604  Transform screentransform() const override{
5605  //Scale negatively on Y axis to match
5606  //Python's coordinate system.
5607  //without this scaling, top left is 0,0
5608  //instead of the bottom left (which is 0,Y without the scaling)
5609  return Transform().translate(canvas.width()/2, canvas.height()/2).scale(1, -1.0f);
5610  }

5615  void onkeypress(const KeyFunc& func, KeyboardKey key) {
5616  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5617  //determine if key list exists
5618  if (keyBindings[0].find(key) == keyBindings[0].end()) {
5619  keyBindings[0][key] = std::list<KeyFunc>();
5620  }
5621  //then push it to the end of the list
5622  keyBindings[0][key].push_back(func);
5623  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5624  }
5625 
5629  virtual void onkeyrelease(const KeyFunc& func, KeyboardKey key) {
5630  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5631  //determine if key list exists, if not, make one
5632  if (keyBindings[1].find(key) == keyBindings[1].end()) {
5633  keyBindings[1][key] = std::list<KeyFunc>();
5634  }
5635  //then push it to the end of the list
5636  keyBindings[1][key].push_back(func);
5637  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5638  }

5644  return;

5646  func();
5647  }
5648  }

5654  return;

5673  void click(int x, int y, MouseButton button) {
5674  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5675  for (MouseFunc& func : mouseBindings[button]) {
5676  func(x, y);
5677  }
5678  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5679  }
5680 
5682  inline void click(const Point& pt, MouseButton button){
5683  click(pt.x, pt.y, button);
5684  }

5690  timerBindings.emplace_back(std::make_tuple(func, time, detail::epochTime()));

5697  if(redrawCounter > 0 || redrawCounter >= redrawCounterMax){
5698  tracer(1, delayMS);
5699  }

5701  onclick([&](int x, int y) {

5703  });

5790 
5796  void initEventThread(){
5797  eventThread.reset(new std::thread([&]() {
5798  //Mouse button states, between updates.
5799  //Keeps track of release/press etc
5800  //states for all three mouse buttons for isDown.
5801  //*importantly, this allows us to avoid repeated events.
5802  bool mButtons[3] = {false, false, false};
5803  //Same thing for keys here.
5804  //(this is a list of keys marked as being in a "down" state)
5805  std::list<KeyboardKey> mKeys;
5806 
5807  while (!display.is_closed() && !killEventThread) {
5808  //Updates all input.
5809  if (!display.is_event()) {
5810  std::this_thread::yield();
5811  continue;
5812  }
5813 
5814  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5815 
5816  Transform mouseOffset = screentransform();
5817  Point mousePos = {
5818  static_cast<int>((static_cast<float>(display.mouse_x()) - mouseOffset.getTranslateX()) * mouseOffset.getScaleX()),
5819  static_cast<int>((static_cast<float>(display.mouse_y()) - mouseOffset.getTranslateY()) * mouseOffset.getScaleY())
5820  };
5821 
5822  //Update mouse button input.
5823  const unsigned int button = display.button();
5824  bool buttons[3] = {
5825  static_cast<bool>(button & 1), //left
5826  static_cast<bool>(button & 2), //right
5827  static_cast<bool>(button & 4) //middle
5828  };
5829 
5830  for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
5831  if (!(!mButtons[i] && buttons[i]))//is this button state "down"?
5832  continue; //if not, skip its processing loop.
5833 
5834  for (MouseFunc& func : mouseBindings[i]) {
5835  //append to the event cache.
5836  InputEvent e;
5837  e.type = false;
5838  e.mX = mousePos.x;
5839  e.mY = mousePos.y;
5840  e.cbPointer = reinterpret_cast<void*> (&func);
5841  cachedEvents.push_back(e);
5842  }
5843  }
5844 
5845  const auto& keys = NAMED_KEYS;
5846 
5847  //iterate through every key to determine its state,
5848  //then call the appropriate callbacks.
5849  for (const auto& keyPair : keys) {
5850  KeyboardKey key = keyPair.second;
5851  const bool lastDown = std::find(mKeys.begin(), mKeys.end(), key) != mKeys.end();
5852  const bool curDown = display.is_key((unsigned int) key);
5853 
5854  int state = -1;
5855  if (!lastDown && curDown) {
5856  //Key down.
5857  state = 0;
5858  mKeys.push_back(key);
5859  } else if (lastDown && !curDown) {
5860  //Key up.
5861  state = 1;
5862  mKeys.remove(key);
5863  } else continue; //skip on case where it was down and is down
5864 
5865  try {
5866  //will throw if no bindings available for key,
5867  //and that's perfectly fine, so we just silently catch
5868  auto& bindingList = keyBindings[state][key];
5869  for (auto& cb : bindingList) {
5870  cb();
5871  }
5872  } catch (...) {}
5873  }
5874 
5875  mButtons[0] = buttons[0];
5876  mButtons[1] = buttons[1];
5877  mButtons[2] = buttons[2];
5878  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5879  }
5880  }));
5881  }
5882 
5884  std::list<SceneObject> objects;
5885 
5887  std::list<Turtle*> turtles;
5888 
5891  std::unique_ptr<std::thread> eventThread;
5894  std::list<InputEvent> cachedEvents;
5896  bool killEventThread = false;
5899  std::mutex eventCacheMutex;
5900 
5901  //this is an array. 0 for keyDown bindings, 1 for keyUp bindings.
5902  std::unordered_map<KeyboardKey, std::list<KeyFunc>> keyBindings[2] = {
5903  {},
5904  {}
5905  };
5906  //similar, mouseb_left mouseb_middle mouseb_right bindings.
5907  std::list<MouseFunc> mouseBindings[3] = {
5908  {},
5909  {},
5910  {}
5911  };
5912  //timer bindings, one function per originating time and delta.
5913  std::list<std::tuple<TimerFunc, uint64_t, uint64_t>> timerBindings;
5914 
5915  //map of fonts. only "default" is initially populated.
5916  std::unordered_map<std::string, std::unique_ptr<BitmapFont>> fonts;
5917  };
5918 
5919  typedef InteractiveTurtleScreen TurtleScreen;
5920 #endif /*CTURTLE_HEADLESS*/
5921 }
